Title: Project Index Results
DescriptionLines: Querying an index results in matching documents that satisfy the query.
However, **index results can be projected**.
* You can ask the server to return only some of the documents' fields.
* You can customize the projected fields.
Retrieving partial document data from the server reduces network traffic load.
The returned projected objects are Not tracked by the sessions as they are not full documents.

Walkthroughs.Title: Define the Map index class
DescriptionLines: * Create the Map index class - inherit from `AbstractCsharpIndexCreationTask`.

Walkthroughs.Title: The index constructor
DescriptionLines: * The _map_ defines the index-fields content - which fields from the 'Employee' document will compose each index-field.
* The index built will contain a list of indexed terms for each index-field specified in the Map function, and a mapping to the relevant document.
* These indexed terms can later be queried on to get their matching documents, the documents that contain them.
* In this example, the 'HiredAt.Year' data is indexed in the _WorkingInCompanySince_ index-field.

Walkthroughs.Title: Deploy the index
DescriptionLines: * Use the `execute()` method to deploy the index to the server.
* Once the index is deployed, the server will start the _'indexing process'_,
in which the index iterates over the documents, building a map between the terms derived from the document fields indexed and the actual documents that contain them.
* In the case of a Map-Reduce index, a second stage is applied where the mapped entries are reduced to some aggregated value.
* After the first indexing run, the index will keep this map current without re-processing the entire data,
and will only update the relevant details upon any update/change to any document related to the index.

Walkthroughs.Title: Query for documents
DescriptionLines: * Query the 'Employees' collection using the defined index.
* The resulting documents will include only employees that started working after 'startYear'.

Walkthroughs.Title: Set the query
DescriptionLines: * Pass the raw-query-string to the session `rawQuery()` method.

Walkthroughs.Title: Execute the Query
DescriptionLines: * The _employeesQuery_ variable only stores the query definition.
Execute the query by calling `all()`, or any other method that forces immediate execution.
* The final query results include only partial/projected details for employees that started working after 'startYear'.
* The resulting objects are Not tracked by the session since they are not the stored documents but only partial data.
